definition[0]: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing
example[0]: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
example[1]: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
example[2]: ‘It’s hot!’ ‘Well, it was bound to be – I just took it out of the oven.’
explanation[0]: Bound to is used mainly in spoken English. In written English, people usually use certain to, it is inevitable that instead:
